entry.title: CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web
entry.summary: Styling ranges of text in software is a very useful thing to be able to do. Thankfully, we have the CSS Custom Highlight API to look forward to because it represents the future of styling text ranges on the web.â€¦ CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Ahmad Shadeed: Use Cases For CSS fit-content
entry.summary: Ahmad Shadeed covers the CSS fit-content sizing keyword. Itâ€™s useful! It just doesnâ€™t come up super often. I find myself using min-content a lot more, like when setting up the height of a grid-template-row. The fit-content keyword is actually â€¦ Ahmad Shadeed: Use Cases For CSS fit-content originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.summary: Kinda silly sounding, isnâ€™t it? CSS database queries. But, hey, CSS is capable of talking to other languages in the sense that it can set the values of things that they can read. Plus, CSS can request other files, and â€¦ CSS Database Queries? Sure We Can! originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: 5 Accessibility Quick Wins You Can Implement Today
entry.summary: Letâ€™s face it: building an AA or AAA-accessible product can be quite daunting. Luckily, having an accessible product isnâ€™t all-or-nothing. Even seemingly small improvements can have nice quality of life benefits for many people. In that spirit, here are five â€¦ 5 Accessibility Quick Wins You Can Implement Today originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Before I go: When it comes to complaining about web browsers
entry.summary: Thatâ€™s a damn one-two punch from Dave. He goes for the ultimate clickbait titleÂ¹, then follows up with a pile of epic advice for us all. If you want web browsers to get better, listen up: Complaining on â€¦ Before I go: When it comes to complaining about web browsers originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Reliably Send an HTTP Request as a User Leaves a Page
entry.summary: On several occasions, Iâ€™ve needed to send off an HTTP request with some data to log when a user does something like navigate to a different page or submit a form. Consider this contrived example of sending some information to â€¦ Reliably Send an HTTP Request as a User Leaves a Page originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: A Complete Guide to CSS Cascade Layers
entry.summary: This is your complete guide to CSS cascade layers, a CSS feature that allows us to define explicit contained layers of specificity, so that we have full control over which styles take priority in a project without relying on specificity â€¦ A Complete Guide to CSS Cascade Layers originally published on CSS-Tricks. entry.title: Add-to-Calendar Button UI Widget
entry.summary: A useful little UI widget thingy here from Jens Kuerschner. Click the add-to-calendar button, get a list of calendar apps, the user selects which one they actually use, and they get what they need for that calendar. Could be a â€¦ Add-to-Calendar Button UI Widget originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.summary: Last year, Elise Blanchard did some great historical research and discovered that blue hyperlinks replaced black hyperlinks in 1993. entry.title: v1.14.2
entry.summary: New: Adjust article grouping based on timezone. You need to add timezone in osmosfeed.yml for accurate grouping. See details in documentation. New: Card title now toggles card content New: all toggles on the UI are persisted with local storage. You can use it to track read/unread status within a single browser. New: Build timestamp now links to the GitHub Action run Changed: Sources are sorted based on publish time rather than alphabetical order Changed: Style adjusted for easier reading Fixed: Horizontal overflow on Safari Fixed: HTML syntax error in default template

entry.title: v1.14.0: V1.14.0 (#79)
